recipes.title: Chili
recipes.description: A friend and family favorite.  Cowboys and Chili anyone?

steps: Brown 3 lbs Ground Beef until mostly done (it will continue to cook)
Add Onion (chopped) and 12 cloves garlic (minced)
Cook for 3-5 minutes until onions brown a bit
Add Spices and Tomatoes
Bring to a boil and let it simmer for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Doctor's Daily Bread
recipes.description: A hearty bread made with only nuts and seeds.  It's a dense brick but Cayce loves having bread again.

steps: Line a 2lb loaf tin with parchment paper and/or lightly grease with olive oil.
Mix dry ingredients in a medium bowl.
Pour in the water and olive oil and mix well.  Start with half the water.
Pack the mixture into your prepared tin.
Leave it to soak for 30 minutes - 8 hours at this stage. (overnight is best)
Bake for 60 minutes at 375 or 335 with convection.
Remove from the tin and bake for a further 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely before slicing. (this takes a long time)
Used 150 g of Amaranth Flour on first attempt.
Used 30g Amaranth Flour - 30g Coconut Flour - 90g Tiger Nut Flour on second attempt - 11-22-2025

recipes.title: Oat and Flax Wraps
recipes.description: With just four simple ingredients, these homemade wraps are quick, wholesome, and endlessly versatile. Forget the shop-bought versions — once you try making your own, you’ll never look back.

steps: Gather and prepare your ingredients.
Place the oats into a blender and blend until you have a flour-like consistency.
Add the flax, water, and salt and blend again until you have a smooth batter.  Start with half the water then add more later to fully mix well.

Heat a small amount of olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in the batter and gently swirl it around the pan or use the back of a spoon, until you have a wide flat surface. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until they are sturdy enough to flip without breaking. Remove onto a wire rack to cool before using. (The batter will thicken as it rests, add small splashes of water to loosen as needed).

recipes.title: Chickpea and Flax Wraps
recipes.description: With just four simple ingredients, these homemade wraps are quick, wholesome, and endlessly versatile. Forget the shop-bought versions — once you try making your own, you’ll never look back.

steps: Gather and prepare your ingredients.
Add the chickpea flour, flax, water, and salt and blend again until you have a smooth batter.  Start with half the water then add more later to fully mix well.

Heat a small amount of olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in the batter and gently swirl it around the pan or use the back of a spoon, until you have a wide flat surface. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until they are sturdy enough to flip without breaking. Remove onto a wire rack to cool before using. (The batter will thicken as it rests, add small splashes of water to loosen as needed).

recipes.title: Keto Salisbury Steak
recipes.description: Stephens loved frozen Salisbury Steaks so this is a substitute to make it keto.

steps: Combine all of the steak ingredients in a medium sized bowl and mix well.
Form into 3 oval patties, about 1 inch thick, and place them on a cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated 375° (F) oven for 18 minutes.
Melt the butter and bacon fat (if using) in a large skillet (4 Tbsp total).
Add the 1 cup mushrooms and cook on medium high heat until golden brown (about 3 minutes per side.)
Add the 1/2 cup onions and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat, until golden and soft.
Add the 1/2 cup broth and the 1/4 tsp Worcestershire sauce, stir and cook for 3 minutes, stirring to scrape any bits off of the bottom of the pan.
Add the 1/4 cup sour cream, stir well, and remove from the heat. (if you want a thicker gravy you can cook it on low for a 5 extra minutes to condense it.)
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve over the warm Salisbury Steaks

recipes.title: Roasted Turkey
recipes.description: Is it Thanksgiving?

steps: Combine 4 tablespoons salt and sugar in bowl. Place turkey, breast side up, on counter. Using your fingers, carefully loosen skin covering breast and legs. Rub 4 teaspoons salt-sugar mixture under skin of each breast, 2 teaspoons under skin of each leg, and remaining salt-sugar mixture inside cavity. Tuck wings behind back and tie legs together with kitchen twine. Place turkey on wire rack set in rimmed baking sheet and refrigerate, uncovered, for 24 to 48 hours.

At least 30 minutes before roasting turkey, adjust oven rack to lowest position, set baking stone on rack, set roasting pan on baking stone, and heat oven to 500 degrees. Combine 1 1/2 teaspoons oil and baking powder in small bowl. Pat turkey dry with paper towels. Rub oil mixture evenly over turkey. Cover turkey breast with double layer of aluminum foil.

Remove roasting pan from oven. Drizzle remaining 2 tablespoons oil into roasting pan. Place turkey, breast side up, in pan and return pan to oven. Reduce oven temperature to 425 degrees and roast for 45 minutes.
Remove foil, reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees, and continue to roast until breast registers 160 degrees and drumsticks/thighs register 175 degrees, 1 to 1 1/2 hours longer.
Using spatula, loosen turkey from roasting pan; transfer to carving board and let rest, uncovered, for 45 minutes.

recipes.title: ATK - Turkey Gravy
recipes.description: Giblets and Neck anyone?

steps: Heat oven to 450 degrees. Place oil, turkey trimmings, carrot, celery, onions, and garlic in cast iron pan.  Roast, stirring every 10 minutes, until well-browned, 40 to 50 minutes.
Remove pan from oven, and place over burner set at high heat; add 4 cups turkey broth and bring to boil, scraping up browned bits on bottom of pan with wooden spoon.
Transfer contents of pan to large saucepan. Add 2 cups turkey broth, 3 cups water, and thyme; bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until reduced by half, about 1 1/2 hours.
Strain stock into large container. Cool to room temperature; cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until fat congeals, at least 1 hour.

To finish gravy, skim fat from stock using soup spoon; reserve fat. Pour stock through fine-mesh strainer to remove remaining bits of fat; discard bits in strainer. 
Bring stock to simmer in medium saucepan over medium-high heat.

In second medium saucepan, heat 4 tablespoons reserved turkey fat over medium-high heat until bubbling; whisk in flour and cook, whisking constantly, until combined and honey-colored, about 2 minutes. Continuing to whisk constantly, gradually add hot stock; bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve with turkey.
(Can be refrigerated up to 3 days; reheat in medium saucepan over medium heat until hot, about 8 minutes.)

recipes.title: Un-Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: All the flavors of stuff bell peppers with easier preparation and less pepper per bite for those that don't like bells that much.

steps: Brown 1 lb ground beef.  Add in 1 Tbsp minced garlic, and 1 chopped onion when beef is half done.
Add 10 oz cauliflower, 2 Bell Peppers, can tomato sauce, 1 Tsp Salt, 1 Tsp Cajun Seasoning, 1 Tbsp All Purpose Seasoning, ¼ Tsp Black Pepper.  Stir and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to simmer, cover pan for 15 minutes or until cauliflower is done.
Add cheese to top and allow to melt.

recipes.title: Cornbread
recipes.description: Adapted from watching Tempie cook - she didn't really measure so we did the best we could to aproximate.

steps: Add 2 Tbsp oil to iron skillet and place in oven - preheat to 400°
Combine dry ingredients in medium bowl: 2 cups cornmeal, 2 Tbsp flour, 2 tsp baking powder, ¼ tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt
In another bowl, beat 2 eggs until mixed, stir in 2 cups kefir
Stir wet mixture into dry mixture until well mixed
Pour into hot skillet
Bake for 23 minutes or until golden

recipes.title: Cornbread Dressing
recipes.description: Family Thanksgiving dressing adapted to fit in a standard 9x12 pan.  Multiply up if you are cooking for a bigger crew.

steps: crumble 1 pan cornbread in large mixing bowl
Add 1/2 diced onion and 3 stalks diced celery to small stock pot and cover with water.
Boil onions and celery until they soften.
Pour onions, celery, and water over cornbread.
Pour broth over cornbread a little at a time and mix well until mixture is thick but wet - not runny.
Add salt, pepper, and sage to taste.
Spread in 9x12 dish and bake at 350 until brown.

recipes.title: Mayonnaise
recipes.description: Why buy it when you can make it at home in 5 minutes!

steps: Crack the 1 egg into large mouth quart sized mason jar
Add the 1 Tsp Dijon mustard, 2 Tsp apple cider vinegar, and 1 Tsp salt on top of the eggs, trying not to disturb the eggs. Do not whisk or stir.
Pour the oil on top. Again, do not whisk or stir.

Carefully submerge an immersion blender into the bottom of the jar, so that it's right where the egg is. Blend on low power for about 20 seconds without moving, until you see most of the jar has turned white. Then, slowly start to move the blender upward, without lifting the blender out into the air. Once you reach the top of the oil, slowly move back down to the bottom. Go up and down like this a few times, until mayonnaise forms.

recipes.title: Grain Free Dressing
recipes.description: Tempie's cornbread dressing adapted to be grain free.

list.name: Salt
list.notes: lower to 1/2 tsp if broth is salted

steps: Preheat to 400° convection
Add butter to cast iron skillet and melt on stovetop on low (so butter doesn’t burn)
Add onions, celery, salt and pepper, and sauté until soft
Combine dry ingredients in large bowl. Whisk until lumps are crushed.
Stir wet ingredients into dry mixture until well combined.
Add butter and veggies to mixture and stir.
Pour into hot skillet.
Bake for 21 minutes or until golden.

recipes.title: Keto Lasagna
recipes.description: This keto lasagna definitely fits the bill because it is nothing but the good stuff.  No zucchini pasta to be found!  The best part is this low carb lasagna recipe can be made any night of the week.  It's that easy!

steps: Preheat the oven to 375F

In a large pot over medium high heat, brown and crumble the sausage and ground beef with the onion and garlic, drain any excess grease. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the marinara and spinach. Remove from the heat and set aside.
In a separate medium mixing bowl, mix together the ricotta, eggs, Italian seasoning, garlic, and 1 cup of the parmesan cheese.
In a large 9x13 casserole or baking dish, layer half of the meat mixture in the bottom. layer all of the ricotta mixture on top.
Now the rest of the meat mixture goes on top of the ricotta mixture
Finish off by sprinkling the mozzarella and the remaining ½ cup of parmesan.
Bake in the pre-heated oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Double the recipe for 2 keto lasagnas and freeze one of them for later. (freezing instructions below)
Add some fresh basil in the sauce to perk up the flavor.
Add in slices of provolone cheese for even more cheesy goodness!

Freezing instructions: If you want to freeze the whole lasagna, assemble it in a foil 9x13 baking pan and then wrap tightly with foil.  Place in the freezer and keep frozen for up to 2 months.  When you are ready to serve it, remove it from the freezer and bake in the oven until the internal temperature reaches 165F.

recipes.title: Creamy Tuscan Garlic Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy Tuscan Garlic Chicken has the most amazing creamy garlic sauce with spinach and sun dried tomatoes. This is a restaurant quality meal that’s easy to make at home in just 30 minutes!

steps: Preheat oven to 425°
Spray 9x12 pan and layout chicken pieces.  Cook for 35 minutes.
In a large skillet add olive oil and heat on medium heat
Add the 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup chicken broth, 2 tsp garlic powder, 2 tsp Italian seasoning, and 1 cup parmesan cheese.
Whisk over medium high heat until it starts to thicken.
Add the 2 cups spinach and 1 cup sundried tomatoes and let it simmer until the spinach starts to wilt.
Mix in mini-chopper
Note: Use largest mini chopper bowl if tripling recipe.

recipes.title: Candied Pecans
recipes.description: These 5-minute Stovetop Candied Pecans are a quick and easy way to make sweet glazed pecans for salads, snacking, food gifts, and more! It’s all made in one pan for minimal mess, and it’s overall much quicker and easier than the oven method. Plus, no candy thermometer needed!

steps: Prepare Parchment Paper on a large cooling rack or flat heat-safe surface
Measure out 2 cups of pecans
Add 1 cup brown sugar, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp cinnamon, and about ⅛ cup water (½ of measured amount) to skillet
Turn heat to medium-high
Stir to mix ingredients.  Add more of the water if needed to get sugar to dissolve.
Cook until mixture bubbles thoroughly.  2-5 minutes.  Stir by swirling the pan.
Add 2 cups pecan halves to the pan and stir to coat pecans.
Cook for 3-5 minutes - stir occasionally
Pour mixture onto prepared parchment and allow to cool.

recipes.title: Keto Chicken Parmesan
recipes.description: Easy and Keto friendly.

steps: Sprinkle chicken on both sides with salt, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning.
Bake chicken for 30 minutes.
Pour tomato sauce over chicken and flip chick around the get it covered in sauce.
Sprinkle parmesan cheese and mozzarella on top.
Return to oven until cheese is melted and slightly browned.
Heat pan on medium-high heat
Split beef into 2 halves.  Form each half into a patty.
Season both sides and edges with salt and pepper.
Use thumb to add a divot in the middle of each steak - to help it cook more eventy.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit.
Add steaks to pan once the pan has had time to heat up - 4-5 minutes.
Flip steaks after browning starts to creep up the sides - about 4-5 minutes.
After browning both sides of the steak, move it to oven to finish cooking, about 10 minutes.
Add 1 1/2 cup beef broth to pan, turn heat to medium.  Scrape bottom with spatula.
Add 1/4 tsp garlic powder.
Once broth has reduced down to about half, add 5/8 cup heavy cream
Reduce again until you can pull the gravy across the pan and it is think enough not to fill in the gaps you just made immediately.

recipes.title: Aunt Kay's Blueberry Pie
recipes.description: Stephens' favorite dessert goes way back to childhood and Aunt Kay's Blueberry Pie!

steps: Preheat oven to 350˚ F. And butter a 9×13 baking dish.
Crush graham crackers into crumbs. Mix the crumbs with the sugar and then the melted butter until crumbly.
Press into 9×13 baking pan. Bake for 8 minutes. Let cool.
In a large mixing bowl, mix 24 oz. cream cheese,  3/4 cup powdered sugar, and about 1 1/2 cup of whipping cream.  Add whipping cream as needed to get mixture thinned enough to spread over crust.
Spread cream cheese layer over cooled crust evenly.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine ¾ cup sugar, 4 ½ tbsp cornstarch, ¼ tsp salt and 1/3 cup water until smooth.
Add 6 cups blueberries.
Bring to a boil
Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly
Remove from the heat.
Add 1 ½  tbsp butter, 1 ½ tbsp lemon juice and remaining berries
stir until butter is melted.
Cool.
Add to 9x13 on top of cream cheese layer.
In a large mixing bowl, whip 2 cups whipping cream until firm.  This takes 2-3 minutes with a mixer on high.
Add 2 Tbsp powdered sugar and mix well.
Add whipped cream layer on top of blueberry pie filling layer in 9x13.

recipes.title: Cranberry Salsa
recipes.description: Debbie brought this to Thanksgiving around 2022 and it was a big hit.

steps: Process all ingredients in a food processor
Chill in refrigerator at least one hour
Taste and add sugar as needed (more sugar may be needed to counteract the bitterness of cranberries
Server over softened brick of cream cheese with crackers

recipes.title: Texas Caviar
recipes.description: Texas Caviar is an easy appetizer that is perfect for parties! Serve with Fritos!

steps: Combine all ingredients into large bowl and stir.  Cover bowl and refrigerate overnight.

recipes.title: Keto Ranch Dressing
recipes.description: You’re just 5 minutes away from this simple, creamy, herbaceous keto ranch dressing recipe!

steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, chives, parsley, dill, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.
Tastes better if the ingredients have time to marinade (1-2 hours)

recipes.title: Bean Dip
recipes.description: If you are a fan of bean dip this CopyCat Fritos Bean Dip Recipe is sure to save you a bundle.

steps: Process all ingredients in a mini-chopper.

recipes.title: Spinach Dip
recipes.description: Sometimes simple is better. Case in point: this creamy, luscious dip you can throw together in a flash for any party or last minute guests.

steps: Melt 2 tbsp butter in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
Sauté onions until soft, 3–5 minutes.
Stir in ½ tsp paprika and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add 10 ounces spinach, 8 ounces cream cheese, ¾ cup cream, ½ tsp salt, and ¼ tsp pepper and cook, stirring, until warmed through and slightly reduced, 8–10 minutes
Add more cream if needed to reach desired consistency.
Gather and prepare your ingredients.

Place the teff flour, tiger nut flour, teff grain, ground flax and cinnamon into a bowl and whisk to combine. Pour over the maple syrup, olive oil and water and mix to combine. Cover with a wet tea towel and set aside to soak until the following day.  Note: Do not overmix the dough. Don’t compact the ball too much as it’s best for some air to flow through the high oil content. It can soak for up to 48 hours, but leave it in the fridge if this is the case.
Mix flaxseed and water and allow to sit for 30 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 410°F/ 375°F convection. When you are ready to bake your dough, drop the salt and baking soda onto the top of the dough. Pour the lemon juice over the baking soda and allow it to fizz. Add flaxseed mixture and stir gently.

Sprinkle the remaining teff grain onto a clean work surface. Turn the dough out onto the grain and lightly roll it around using your hands to shape it into a ball. You want the inner mixture to stay wet and soft and want a good coating of teff grain on the outside. There is no need to knead the dough. Using your hands, lightly press the ball down into a circle 3 inches high. Cut the circle into 6 triangles.
Transfer the scones onto a tray covered in baking paper. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes.
Take out of the oven and leave on the tray for 5 minutes. After, you can transfer the scones to a wire rack to cool.

recipes.title: 'Easy' Turkey Gravy
recipes.description: Still takes forever but not as crazy as the American Test Kitchen version.  Serving size 3 1/3 tbsp.

steps: In a large pot, add broth and reserved turkey parts or chicken livers. Bring to a boil over med-high heat.  If you can't fit all the broth just add as much as will fit for now and hold the rest aside.  Let boil for about 10 minutes to extract flavor from turkey or chicken parts.
While broth is coming to a boil - in a large pan over low heat (2%), add butter and flour to make a rue.  Stir until smooth.

If you have broth that didn't fit in the large pot, start adding it to the large pan rue - about 1/4 cup at first.  This will cause the flour mixture to form clumps.  Stir until smooth, breaking up the clumps.  Then add more broth (a little more each time) until it is all incorporated and smooth.  Mixture should begin to boil gently - forming a few bubbles.  Increase heat if necessary to reach this boil - but reduce if the boil gets more aggressive.

Remove turkey or chicken parts from the large part with a slotted spoon or colander.  Now start to incorporate the broth from the large pot in to the rue (a little more each time) until it is all mixed and smooth.
Allow gravy mixture to come back to a gentle boil and stir often until the gravy thickens.  Volumn should reduce by 35% - 40%.
Add salt to taste.
Note: 8 cups broth yields 5 cups of gravy.

recipes.title: Turkey & Dressing Muffins
recipes.description: Make use of leftover turkey and give it the taste of dressing without the carbs!

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease 15 silicon muffin cups - place in muffin tin or other pan.
Sauté celery, onion, and mushrooms in butter for 5 minutes.
Add riced cauliflower and cook 3 minutes, just until moisture cooks off (don’t brown).
Add turkey, poultry seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Remove pan from heat and let sit 2–3 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk blended cottage cheese, eggs, cream, mozzarella, and chicken drippings.
Combine custard with turkey mixture and mix thoroughly.
Pack tightly into 15 muffin cups.
Bake 20–24 minutes, until lightly golden and set. Toothpick should come out mostly clean.

Fridge: Up to 5 days.
Freezer: 2–3 months (freeze solid, then bag).
Reheat: Air fryer 3–4 minutes at 350°F

recipes.title: Turkey Soup
recipes.description: A delicious way to use up that left-over Thanksgiving turkey.

steps: To make your own broth - instant pot the turkey carcass and innards with 8 cups of water.  Add 1 tbsp salt.  Pressure cook for 1 hour.  Quick release.
Chop celery, carrots, onion, and turkey.  Dice potatoes.
Strain broth to remove carcass, bones, innards, etc.
Add celery, carrots, onion, potatoes, and turkey to the strained broth in the instant pot.
Add salt to taste.  Add dill.
Pressure cook for 2 minutes.

recipes.title: Lentil Curry
recipes.description:
This authentic flavor combination of fresh
tomatoes, mustard seeds and curry leaves takes me back to my travels to Kerala and Goa. The addition of lentils and green beans to the tomatoes really packs in the protein and vegetables per portion, making this beautifully balanced and light. Because of the lentils, I don’t think this curry needs to be served with rice, but you can if you wish.

steps: Gather and prepare your ingredients.

For the curry paste, soak the dried chillies and coconut in the boiling water for 10 minutes. Tip the soaked chillies and coconut, along with the water, into a food processor or blender with the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.

Heat the coconut oil in a heavy-based saucepan over a medium-low heat. Add the star anise, cumin, and turmeric with seasoning, and fry for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the curry paste and fry for 5 minutes, stirring continuously, until it thickens and intensifies in flavor.
Add the lentils, coconut milk and stock. Bring to a simmer and cook gently for 20 minutes until the lentils are soft.
Add the chicken and spinach and cook for a further 8 minutes or until the chicken is just cooked through.
To serve, spoon the curry into bowls and garnish with lime wedges for squeezing.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Roll Dip
recipes.description: Serving size - 1 Tbsp

steps: Whip heavy cream for about 2 minutes until it becomes whipping cream.  Add 2 tbsp powdered sugar and mix until incorporated.
In a bowl combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon, then fold in whipping cream until fully combined. Top with cinnamon sugar, and serve with graham crackers for dipping.
